data.text: @Claraphipps007 @LoveWilko Won't be going anywhere near a Wilko now. Thanks for the info

@mouldcapital @Claraphipps007 @LoveWilko Would love to see that data. Would be very interested to see how it was collected. Regardless, if it’s “most” then it’s not “all”, so asymptomatic spreading is still a risk.

@MarkShepherd7 @Claraphipps007 @LoveWilko No you weren't right I'm afraid. You original post claimed it was government policy to go into work with covid, as if it were advisable, which is not the case. Wiko are not breaking the law with their stance but are no longer following employer guideline advice on the matter. https://t.co/FWPbXRCpd5

@MarkShepherd7 @Claraphipps007 @LoveWilko Incorrect - the government's advice is to self isolate for 5 days (just not law anymore). Workplace guidance still clearly advises that employers should not ask (or let) employees come to work if testing positive for covid. Wilko have misinterpreted the changes.

@realjtk @Claraphipps007 @LoveWilko Actually, if you look at the data most of the covid was spread by people who know they have the virus leaving the house. What wilko should be doing is asking staff to get pcr test confirmation
@mouldcapital @Claraphipps007 @LoveWilko It’s not unlikely at all. You can still transmit COVID-19 even if you don’t have symptoms. The scientists have been telling us this for two years now.
@spazhession @LoveWilko You don't go to work with flu either. 🙄🤦‍♀️
@Claraphipps007 @LoveWilko I've seen that if you have covid and still feel well you can now go to work. It going to be like the flu we will all get it at some point

@Claraphipps007 @LoveWilko Not defending the govt or Wilko, but if you have no symptoms then it's very unlikely you're gonna pass the virus on to someone else, and that positive could be a false positive.

@MarkShepherd7 @LoveWilko At no time did I say It was 'illegal' to go to work with covid. Contagious illnesses should be contained. Would you attend work with influenza or norovirus!? The infection rate is still very high. The legal requirement to isolate has gone, the moral one has not.
